title: Arch Linux
summary:
Arch Linux (/ɑːrtʃ/)[6] is a Linux distribution created for computers with x86-64 processors.[7] 
Arch Linux adheres to the KISS principle ("Keep It Simple, Stupid").[8] The project attempts to have minimal distribution-specific changes, and therefore minimal breakage with updates, and be pragmatic over ideological design choices and focus on customizability rather than user-friendliness.[9]
